title: Dad threatened girl,11, with scissors and raped her three times
text:
Brett David Hill has admitted raping the 11-year-old girl three times (Picture: Facebook)

A dad raped an 11-year-old girl three times after snatching her in a park on her way to school.

Brett David Hill, 49, from New South Wales, Australia, forced the child into his car by threatening her with a pair of scissors at around 9.15am on June 12 last year.

He abused her at three different locations in a five hour ordeal before dumping her at a railway station in Newcastle, Australia.

Hill was caught four days later after a huge manhunt and has pleaded guilty to nine charges.

The victim’s dad glared at the paedophile and called out ‘enjoy prison mate’ as the predator was taken from court, Yahoo News reports.

Police launched a huge man hunt to find the attacker (Picture: 7News/METROGRAB)

Hill had been due to stand trial yesterday after initially denying a number of the girl’s claims about what he did to her during the attack.

He will go straight to sentencing after his confession and faces a maximum of 20 years in prison.

Newcastle Superintendent Brett Greentree said the crime send ‘shivers down the spine’ of everyone in the community and thanked locals for their help in tracking Hill down.

Police described Hill as a ‘nomad’ and said information given to detectives about the suspect’s vehicle was a key tip that led to his arrest.

Detective Superintendent John Kerlatec praised the bravery of the victim, who he described as a ‘hero’.

He said: ‘It is remarkable, the strength of this girl, supported by her friends and family, supported by counsellors, but she has stood up.

‘She’s worked with us. Her family and friends have worked with us and she’ll get on with her life.

‘This brave little girl is certainly a hero, and the courage that she has displayed is heroism.’

description: Brett David Hill, 49, from New South Wales, Australia, has pleaded guilty to raping the 11 year old three times
